sentences: Ben Paterson (born June 23, 1982) is an American jazz pianist, organist, composer, and Steinway Artist.
Paterson graduated from the Settlement Music School in Philadelphia after having spent his earlier years studying classical as well as jazz music.
He then relocated to Chicago in 2004 to attend the University of Chicago.
Starting in 2005, Paterson began working as a pianist for Von Freeman, an NEA Jazz Master in Chicago.
In the same year, Paterson relocated to New York City to further his professional music career and gain more exposure in the jazz world.

Paterson has performed as an opening act for B.B. King, Buddy Guy, and Steely Dan, at the 2010 Montreal Jazz Fest, the 2006, 2009, and 2013 Chicago Jazz Fests, the 2007, 2008, and 2011 Chicago Blues Fests, as well as shows in France, China, Switzerland, Mexico, Sweden, and Taiwan.
Starting in 2019 Paterson became one only a few Jazz musicians who are designated Steinway Artists.
